channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 1st October
item.description:
passed through Montpellier Gardens recently and the grate is fully blocked up with moss – it’s deeply entrenched and can’t be removed easily at all. I tried digging away at it a bit out of curiosity with my hands, but it really couldn’t be budged
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 1st October
item.description:
- Marsh Lane quickly fills with surface water, filling from the Hardwick Green side. On Friday it reached about halfway across the road, but normally rainwater streams in from Swindon Road with the corner of Cleveland Street becoming submerged. This is a regular occurrence whenever there is a downpour, no matter how brief it is. There may be something blocking the grates like moss or green growth. Please would you be able to take a look into it?
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 1st October
item.description:
Residents measured the rate of rainfall and found on Friday they were 10 centimetres from their property flooding. They were incredibly anxious and couldn’t sleep from the panic of it, and flooding is often recurrent along the length of Townsend Street and at their section of Swindon Road. The drains on the roadway are often blocked with overgrowth rather than leaves since there are no trees on their street. Please could you look into their situation as a matter of urgency and feed back to me how things go? Thank you so much!
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Croft Lane - Concerns Regarding Path Condition and Overhanging Trees, 1st October
item.description:
Unfortunately, the path along Croft Lane is in very poor condition, which makes it extremely difficult for disabled people to navigate safely. In addition to this, several trees along the lane have overhanging branches, some of which have begun to fall, posing a serious safety risk to anyone using the path. Given these issues, I kindly request that the necessary actions be taken to repair the path and trim the trees before an accident occurs. Thank you for your attention to this matter.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Croft Lane, Leckhampton, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Multiple potholes and road edge deterioration, 1st October
item.description:
There are multiple potholes and road edge deterioration along the stretch of road known as Birdlip Hill from the turn off at Cirencester Road (including a bit of Ermine way) all the way uphill to the junction at Birdlip. A number of previously repaired potholes have opened up again and if facing uphill, on the right hand side of the road in many places the road edge has been scoured away by water and is breaking up. It is hard to pin point an exact location as there are a number of defects, causing traffic on both sides to cross the mid line. In the fog and mist we had today this is especially dangerous.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Ermin Way, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 1st October
item.description:
Customer reports 3 blocked drains in the vicinity of their property - they are full of leaves. Please can we clear them asap, as they have concerns that they will be flooded.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Previously 'repaired' pot hole has broken up yet again, 1st October
item.description:
Lobleys Drive bridge, in the direction from Coopers Edge to Abbeymead. Surface of the road started to break up last weekend. Needs a proper repair this time, not a 10 min repair as normal.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): M5, Hucclecote, Tewkesbury

item.description:
Hi You have received a request via Love Clean Streets to remedy an issue within your Service Area Pothole Lat/Long - 51.88942718, -2.05067086 what3words - fancy.trade.zebra Nearest address - 22 Greenway Lane, Charlton Kings, Cheltenham, GL52 6LB Extra location information if given - Large pothole result of sever rain Reference - 4300832

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Humber Place, Brockworth, Tewkesbury

item.title: Roots of oak tree causing problems for 8 Barrington Avenue, The Reddings, Cheltenham GL51 6TY, 1st October
item.description:
The oak tree is located on public land to the side of 6 Barrington Avenue, The Reddings, Cheltenham, and approximately 8 metres from 8 Barrington Avenue. Our driveway appears to have root incursion as the tarmac by the side of our front entrance and other places has lifted, and recurred after mending. This has been a growing problem for a couple of years. The footpath beside the oak tree is also showing some early signs of root disturbance.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 6, Barrington Avenue, Hatherley, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Loose/rattling cover/ironwork problem, 1st October
item.description:
Customer reports that the new development is pumping water onto the pavement and road at the location. They are elderly and slipped-up yesterday; it is unsafe for them to use the pavement.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Opposite the church permenant large puddle, 1st October
item.description:
Opposite the church there is a semi peppermint large puddle that builds up in the shoulder of the road where there is no drain. As a result when cars drive past pedestrians get drowned. It is 10 feet long and just over 1 foot wide, mostly when drivers are committing the offense of driving inside the double line they drown people on the path.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 23, Saint Stephen's Road, Warden Hill, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
